entry.title: Building Trust in Supplier Data: Insights from Sean Sollitto of Relish
entry.content:
Building Trust in Supplier Data: Insights from Sean Sollitto of Relish

In today‚Äôs volatile business environment, procurement leaders face unprecedented challenges‚Äîranging from supplier fraud to shifting tariffs and sanctions. In the latest episode of SAP‚Äôs Future of Procurement Podcast, Sean Sollitto, Co-Founder and VP of Sales at Relish, shared actionable strategies and forward-looking insights on how automation and AI are reshaping supplier risk management. üåç

Why Manual Validation Is a Risk You Can‚Äôt Afford

Traditional methods of verifying supplier details‚Äîsuch as manual checks for tax IDs or sanctions‚Äîare no longer enough. Sean cited a startling statistic: 84% of companies experience some form of fraud annually, with an average loss of $150,000 per incident. These aren‚Äôt hypothetical risks‚Äîthey‚Äôre real, costly, and growing.

The problem? Manual processes rely on hope, not certainty. Automation ensures consistency, accuracy, and speed‚Äîcritical factors for mitigating risk in today‚Äôs global supply chains.

Automation and AI: The New Risk Management Playbook

Relish‚Äôs Data Assure solution exemplifies this shift. By automating supplier validations‚Äîcovering tax IDs, addresses, sanctions checks, and banking details‚Äîcompanies can monitor risk continuously, not just at onboarding. Daily checks across 150 global sanctions lists and real-time bank account verification in over 50 countries help organizations stay ahead of fraud and compliance pitfalls.

Sean summed it up perfectly: ‚ÄúIf you can automate a process, you can guarantee it happens.‚Äù Without automation, risk management becomes reactive‚Äîand expensive. ü§ñ

Tariffs, Sanctions, and the Power of Real-Time Data

Economic ties shift overnight. Tariffs doubled in some regions this year, and 17,000+ entities now appear on U.S. sanctions lists. For procurement teams, this means constant vigilance. Sean and the SAP team stressed the importance of real-time data pipelines to update supplier profiles and category strategies dynamically.

Knowledge is power‚Äîbut only if it‚Äôs timely. Automated alerts and integrated workflows can trigger offboarding or risk reviews instantly, reducing reputational and financial exposure. üìä

Trust Through Triangulation

How do you trust the data? Sean‚Äôs answer: triangulation. Relish partners directly with curated data sources and banking networks, ensuring multiple points of verification. This approach not only validates supplier credentials but also builds confidence in ESG and diversity metrics‚Äîcritical for compliance in global markets. ‚úÖ

Beyond Suppliers: Expanding the Scope of Validation

Interestingly, these validation practices aren‚Äôt limited to suppliers. Sean revealed that similar checks are now being applied to employees, contractors, and even customers‚Äîespecially in industries where rebates or incentives involve financial transactions. This holistic approach ensures trust across all business relationships, not just procurement. üîç

The Future: AI Agents and Proactive Decision-Making

Looking ahead, Sean predicts a paradigm shift: AI agents embedded in procurement workflows. Instead of waiting for triggers, users will interact conversationally with systems‚Äîasking, for example, ‚ÄúHas Acme Corp been checked for sanctions recently?‚Äù and receiving actionable insights instantly.

Far from replacing humans, AI will augment decision-making, enabling procurement professionals to anticipate risk and optimize supply chains faster than ever before. üåü

Final Thoughts

Risk isn‚Äôt going away‚Äîbut how we manage it is evolving. Automation, AI, and trusted partnerships are redefining procurement from a reactive function to a proactive, strategic powerhouse. As Sean put it, those who learn to leverage these tools will become ‚Äúsuperhumans‚Äù in their organizations.

What‚Äôs your strategy for building trust in supplier data? Share your thoughts and join the conversation! üí¨

üçé  Apple Podcasts: https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/episode-25-trusting-the-data-about-your-suppliers/id1764078646?i=1000744157727

Spotify: https://open.spotify.com/episode/1EYn1znqijauUaA5hfN9Us

entry.title: I need a POV using Joule via BTP, but keeping data and execution on-prem or in NS2.
entry.content:
I need a POV using Joule via BTP, but keeping data and execution on-prem or in NS2.  Here is my answer, wanted review of my pov.

POV

1. Architecture Approach

  • Hybrid Model:
    • Joule UI & orchestration via SAP BTP (public cloud).
    • Data & execution remain on-prem or NS2 using:
      • SAP AI Core/AI Foundation deployed in NS2 or on-prem.
      • Secure connectors (SAP Cloud Connector, Private Link) for controlled interaction.
  • Inference Strategy:
    • Joule prompts processed in BTP but routed to local AI runtime for execution.
    • Sensitive data never leaves NS2/on-prem; only metadata or anonymized context flows to BTP.

2. Key Benefits

  • Compliance & Sovereignty:
    • Meets FedRAMP, ITAR, and other regulatory requirements.
  • Performance & Latency:
    • Local execution reduces dependency on public cloud for heavy workloads.
  • Innovation Access:
    • Still leverages Joule‚Äôs capabilities without compromising security.

3. Challenges

  • Integration Complexity:
    • Requires robust connectivity and governance between BTP and NS2/on-prem.
  • Feature Parity:
    • Some Joule features may depend on public cloud AI services; need fallback or custom models locally.
  • Cost & Maintenance:
    • Running AI Core locally adds infrastructure overhead.

4. Recommended Actions

  • Assess Use Cases:
    • Identify which Joule scenarios require sensitive data handling.
  • Deploy AI Core in NS2:
    • Use SAP AI Core/AI Foundation for local inference.
  • Implement Secure Connectivity:
    • SAP Cloud Connector + Private Link for controlled communication.
  • Governance Framework:
    • Define data classification, prompt filtering, and audit mechanisms.

Key Components

  1. Joule Interface
    Embedded in SAP applications (e.g., S/4HANA, SuccessFactors) for user interaction.

  2. SAP BTP (Public Cloud)
    Acts as the orchestration layer for Joule, handling prompt routing and metadata exchange.

  3. Secure Connectivity

    • SAP Cloud Connector and Private Link ensure encrypted, controlled communication between BTP and NS2/on-prem systems.

  4. On-Prem/NS2 AI Runtime

    • SAP AI Core/AI Foundation deployed locally for inference and processing.
    • Sensitive data never leaves the secure environment.

  5. ERP Systems (S/4HANA, ECC)
    Hosted in NS2/on-prem for transactional and operational data.

  6. Compliance & Governance Layer

    • Enforces FedRAMP, ITAR, and other regulatory standards.
    • Includes audit, logging, and prompt filtering.

Data Flow

  • User ‚Üí Joule ‚Üí BTP ‚Üí Secure Connector ‚Üí NS2 AI Core ‚Üí ERP Systems
  • Only metadata or anonymized context flows to BTP; all sensitive data and execution remain local.

Benefits

  • Regulatory Compliance: Meets strict security and sovereignty requirements.
  • Innovation Access: Leverages Joule without compromising sensitive data.
  • Performance: Local execution reduces latency for critical workloads.

entry.title: Reccommended C_SEC "SAP Security Administration" Practical (not Theoretical) certification material?
entry.content:
Hello, I am looking to take the  C_SEC "SAP Certified Associate - Security Administrator" Practical (not Theoretical, as now that version of the examination is retired) certification: 

https://learning.sap.com/certifications/sap-certified-associate-security-administrator

Does anyone have recommendations on practice materials relevant to the practical version, that are not listed below? (because I am already reviewing them):

  • All "Recommended steps to prepare for the exam" Learning Journeys/Courses on the webpage
  • All digital exercises in each Learning Journey attached (quizzes, step-by-step exercises)
  • All Live Sessions attached to each Learning Journey (under "Level up your skills" section)
  • And the following Hands-On practice systems: Hands-on Practice for Exploring the Authorization Concept for SAP Fiori on SAP S/4HANA (for textbook ADM945), Hands-on Practice for Exploring the Authorization Concept for SAP S/4HANA and SAP Business Suite (for textbook ADM940)

 The Live Sessions directly recommended for this certification are spread out across several months, and not all of them have recordings of previous sessions. I'm not sure what other Hands-On Practice systems or Live Sessions would be beneficial as there are only two Hands-On practice systems directly recommended for this. 

Thank you for any advice

entry.title: Item-level discounts and XML mapping in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition ‚Äì Standard approach?
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

In S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (2508), we are working with item-level discounts in SD using custom condition types (Z conditions). The pricing calculation works correctly and impacts the net value and accounting as expected.

However, when reviewing the e-invoice XML (DRC ‚Äì Colombia), we notice that:

  • Item-level discounts are not represented as Allowance/Charge at line level

  • The XML only reflects net amounts, and AllowanceTotalAmount is populated only when header-level discounts are used

My question to the community is:

  1. Is this the standard and expected behavior in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition?
  2. Do most implementations model commercial discounts at header level if they need to be explicitly shown as Allowances in the XML?
  3.  Or is there any standard configuration (CBC / SD pricing) that allows item-level discounts to be exposed in the XML without custom developments?

I would really appreciate insights from consultants who have implemented SD and e-invoicing in Cloud Public across different countries.

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Re: Is it possible to limit to special files in RAG
entry.content: Hi, Jay, Option A also has limitation. In one project , it will include multiple bid from multiple vendor. So it is not enough. In option B, we use hana vector table. It will increase cost of customer. But it seems in current situation, option B is the reasonable choise. But I think the best is product team fromAI Core and Obj Store work together to improve. Then why OBJ Store? The reason is OBJ store has Attachment plugin in CAP . Which is easy to use . Thanks Jay!

entry.title: Re: SAP Cloud Integration/CPI: How to Return Custom Error Messages to Sender - available options
entry.content:
Hi @MateuszPiotrowski ,

Great blog! I really like how you covered all the different options and approaches. One thing I‚Äôm not a fan of with Groovy script method is that the error messages show java.lang.Exception and the line number, which can make it look like there‚Äôs an internal error to anyone reading it.

If external system is calling the iFlow, I think using the End Message step with a custom status is a better approach, since it‚Äôs the external system‚Äôs job to send the right data. But if the iFlow is just connecting two systems, then using an error exception end should be enough, in my opinion.

Regards,

Nick

entry.title: Create an Outbound Delivery even though Sales Order Line Item does not have the confirmed quantity
entry.content:
Hello Expert,

We have a requirement where we need to create an Outbound Delivery even though Sales Order Line Item does not have the confirmed quantity and this is required for our Shipment Planning process which we do manually based on delivery. We were thinking to refer Sales order for this purpose, but we have multi delivery against a sales order in our business scenario. 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Create an Outbound Delivery even though Sales Order L...
entry.content:
Hello Customer,

Hope you are doing well recently.

If you activate the ATP check for the material, the ATP check will be triggered during Delivery Creation and the delivery quantity in outbound delivery will refer to the confirmed quantity in Schedule Line.

To reach your requirement, you can kindly deactivate the ATP check and the outbound delivery will refer to the quantity in Sales Order.

The deactivation configuration for ATP check is below:

In item category level:

  1. Navigate to SSCUI 102974-Define Delivery Item Categories and select the item category.
  2. Change the field "Do Not Check Availability" to "X" and save the modification.

In material level:

  1. Navigate to APP Change Material -> Tab MRP 3 -> field Availability check.
  2. Change the field as NC and save the modification.

Please feel free to let me know if you have any further question or concern.

 

Best regards,

Crane

SAP Support

entry.title: SAP Universal ID ‚Äì Request to Merge S-user and P-user Accounts and Transfer Learning Certification
entry.content:
I currently have two SAP user accounts associated with different email addresses and Learning Hub profiles, and I would like to request the consolidation of these accounts and the transfer of learning certifications into a single SAP Universal ID.

This account contains one SAP learning certification obtained during my studies.

Request:
I would like to:

Merge or link both accounts under one SAP Universal ID.

Transfer the learning certification currently assigned to the student P-user account to my primary S-user account.

Please let me know the required steps or documentation needed to proceed with this request.
I am sending this request from an email address associated with the accounts mentioned above, as required.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: SAP Universal ID ‚Äì Request to Merge S-user and P-user...
entry.content:
Regarding to your issue, I understand that you need to merge olmartin@tesselar.mx and 20023436@es.uveg.edu.mx into one UID account and transfer your learning certificate to my primary S-user account.

Regarding to your first request, I have delete the UID account 20023436@es.uveg.edu.mx in our backend system so that you can follow the KBA 2882908 - How to add an additional account to a Universal ID to add 20023436@es.uveg.edu.mx into your primary UID account olmartin@tesselar.mx.

Regarding to your another request, please kindly note that our UID support team do not have relevant authorizations to help transfer the learning certificate. 
Please follow the below KBAs to contract the SAP Learning team to help you further.

KBA 2764910 - How to transfer SAP Learning Hub licenses
KBA 2404504 - How to get help with the SAP Learning Hub or SAP Training Center

entry.title: How to optimize stories in SAC mobile so that users do not see "reloaded due to memory constraint"?
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I've designed a three page story in SAC. For each page I've limited the number of widgets and tried to follow best practices according to help portal (https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_ANALYTICS_CLOUD/00f68c2e08b941f081002fd3691d86a7/fbe339efda1241b5a3f46cf17f54cdff.html?q=optimize).

However, I still came across "reloaded due to memory constraint" on mobile apps and mobile web pages. The story can load, but when I swipe, sometimes it will reload. And every time I opens it on mobile, it takes like 30~60 seconds. (I found that for some mobile devices, the story loads faster, but for the other they load slower. But I cannot expect all users using the best mobile devices...)

The story works pretty well on computer, the loading could finish in about 10 seconds.

I'd like to ask: for the mobile version of the SAC story, if I don‚Äôt want to see the message "reloaded due to memory constraint", how should I control the number of widgets on the page or adjust other content? I‚Äôm not quite sure where the threshold lies.

Any tips or insights would be greatly appreciated! Thank you in advance.

SAP Analytics Cloud

entry.title: Re: Explore the analytical capabilities of the Joule appl...
entry.content:
According to your description, I understand you would like to know the licensing cost details for an SAP Public Cloud test & demo system configured with Joule services on SAP BTP. 

However, our support team could only resolve the technical issue but do not have relevant authorizations and knowledge to support such contractual issue.

Regarding to your issue, please kindly refer to KBA 3259711 - Who to contact at SAP for contract and/or licensing questions - SAP for Me

Abstract below information for your reference:

  • Contact your SAP Account Manager (AE) according to KBA 2626344 for help with the following licensing/contract topics:

    .... questions on software usage rights (e.g. Am I allowed to use...)
    .... are we license compliant
    .... which licenses are required
    .... questions on contract verbiage and license entitlements 
    .... products included with licenses (including license "bundles")
    .... need information about a new purchase (e.g. Has order been process, status of purchase order)
    .... how licenses can be utilized for compliance
    .... what are the costs/price and fees associated for products or services 
    .... details about specific license materials (what they are, what they do, etc)

Thus please kindly contact your Account Manager as following for further help.

entry.title: Sequential batch consumption and multiple batches received derivation in prod. order
entry.content:
Many to many batch derivation/ based characteristics  transfer for each sequential consumption and sequential multiple batches  based  good receipt  inside single Production order will have co-relation to track for input & output based properties  transfer ag each stages.  specific point of time.

Suppose Batches : A1 , A2 are there for consumption, starting from A1 Batch of raw material system, consume batch A1 and produced batches are B1,B2, B3 Etc. Similarly from A2 Produced batches are B4, B5,B6, B7 material.

 I suppose to see correlation between them at report level in SAP public cloud that which batches are received from which consumable batches.

entry.title: Storing of documents in database table
entry.content:
In S/4 HANA Public Cloud, I'm developing a custom fiori app that will create a contract upon approval. This app also allows uploading of attachments like pdf files. While transaction is waiting for approval, all information are stored in a custom database table. 

I know there is a DMS in BTP which allow uploading of file without any business object but client is on a budget and cannot afford.

I understand that API_ATTACHMENT_SRV only allow uploading of file when linked to a business object. But in my case, the business object is not yet created.

I'm thinking if I just convert the file into binary rawstring and store it in a custom database in the meantime. Then use the attachment api to upload the file and link it to the created business object and deleting it from the db table.

is it advisable to do this method?

what are the possible implications of doing this method?

entry.title: Down Payment Request Issue
entry.content:
Issue No 1

A Purchase Order (PO) has been created with Supplier A.

During DPR processing, the system allows the DPR to be posted against the same PO but with a different supplier (Supplier B).

The system does not restrict or validate the supplier mismatch and allows DPR posting.

The Purchase Order field must be mandatory during DPR creation.

Issue No 2

  1. We have created a Purchase Order with a value of INR 100.
  2. While posting the DPR, the system allows posting an amount greater than the PO value.
    The system only displays a warning message stating that the order value will be exceeded, but it does not block the posting.

While posting the DPR, the system allows posting more than the Purchase Order value.
The system is not throwing an error message; it only shows a warning that the order value will be exceeded.


We need this warning message to be changed to an error so that posting is blocked when the PO value is exceeded.

Thanks

Achyuta

entry.title: Re: Available stock mapping in go live project with MTO s...
entry.content:
Consider the below approaches

1. Manual Reassignment via Transfer Posting
Use Transfer Posting to move normal stock into sales order stock (special stock type E). Reference the sales order number during transfer so the system reclassifies the stock. This ensures the uploaded stock is now visible against the MTO order.

2. Backflush / Goods Issue Adjustments
For partially closed orders, check if WIP postings already exist. Perform goods issue adjustments to consume the uploaded normal stock into the production/WIP process. This way, the system balances the stock against the MTO requirement.

3. Custom Cutover Mapping
During Go-Live, some projects use custom mapping tables to link uploaded stock to open sales orders. Consultants may run a mass update program to reassign stock categories (normal ‚Üí MTO). This avoids manual postings for large volumes.

4. Production Order Settlement Alignment
If FG is already activated under MTO, ensure that production order settlement consumes the reassigned stock. Align the valuation class and account assignment so financial postings remain consistent.

5. Business Process Decision
If stock cannot be reassigned technically, consider closing old orders and creating new MTO orders linked to the uploaded stock. This is less elegant but sometimes cleaner for audit and reconciliation.

entry.title: Re: Update Ariba System Main IT contact
entry.content:
Hello customer,

Regarding your request to update the main IT contact for the Ariba system, kindly know the main IT contact person for the cloud system is indicated in the corresponding cloud contract, maintained by the SAP Order Management team.

If you need to change the main IT contact person for your Ariba system, you need to reach out to your SAP Account Manager. Your SAP Account Manager can check the contract information and provide you with the required assistance.

If you don't know who is the SAP Account Executive for your customer number xxxx, you may contact the CIC team per KBA 2626344. Then please send email to your account manager and provide your customer number, cloud product contract number (if you know it), and explain that you need to change the IT contact for the required product.

Since this matter relates to contracts, we at SAP Product Support are limited in the assistance we can provide. Your account manager will review the contract information and provide you with the necessary support.

Hope the above information helps.

Thanks and regards,
SAP Support

entry.title: Re: Shipping point issue in Return to Vendor
entry.content: The error occurs because RTV uses outbound delivery logic, which relies on shipping point determination from SD configuration. The plant‚Äôs assigned sales area drives which BP sales area is read. Since your plant is linked to D1, the system looks there, finds no shipping condition, and fails.

entry.title: 8 Critical Pain Points of MCP in an Enterprise
entry.content:
The Model Context Protocol (MCP) is being hailed as the "USB port" for AI agents. But for the enterprise, it is currently a security "Wild West."

While MCP makes it easy to connect LLMs to data and tools, deploying it without a centralized gateway creates a fragmented environment where security policies are nearly impossible to enforce.

If you are moving AI agents from demo to production, here are 8 critical pain points:

  1. The Attribution Gap
    AI agents usually execute tools via service accounts. When a massive data export happens, your log shows "mcp-service-account" instead of the human employee who triggered it. This makes SOX and GDPR compliance impossible.

  2. Over-Privileged Access
    Most MCP setups are all-or-nothing. A user needing to view orders might accidentally inherit the ability to delete them because there is no granular, tool-by-tool authorization.

  3. No Central Kill Switch
    In a decentralized setup, there is no single control point. If a server is compromised, security teams must manually hunt and disconnect dozens of individual agent configurations while the breach spreads.

  4. The "Prompt-to-Delete" Risk
    Prompt injection is a real threat. Without human-in-the-loop gates, a cleverly worded prompt can trick an agent into executing high-risk actions like cleaning up a production database.

  5. Discovery Without Governance
    Currently, agents either see everything or nothing. We lack a middle ground where a user can discover a capability exists but must request formal permission before the agent can execute it.

  6. Cross-Tenant Contamination
    Without strict boundary enforcement, sensitive R&D or executive compensation data can leak into agents used by other departments, violating internal confidentiality.

  7. Forensic Nightmares
    Audit logs are scattered across dozens of servers in inconsistent formats. Correlating who did what and when after a breach takes weeks of manual work instead of minutes.

  8. Shadow AI Integrations
    Developers are already running local MCP servers on their laptops to test with production data. These bypass firewalls and leave zero audit trail, creating massive compliance holes.

The Model Context Protocol is the future of agentic workflows, but the direct connection model does not scale in a regulated environment. Enterprises need a centralized governance layer to enforce authentication and authorization before these agents are given the keys to the kingdom.

How is your team handling the security of AI tool-calling?
